summary: This document is an email chain from August 11, 2019, between CBS News correspondent Matt Pieper and the Federal Bureau of Prisons (BOP) Office of Public Affairs. Pieper is inquiring whether Jeffrey Epstein was on suicide watch while in BOP custody. The BOP declines to comment beyond providing a link to Attorney General William Barr's statement on Epstein's death.

events.title: BOP Declines Comment on Epstein Suicide Watch
events.description: The Bureau of Prisons Office of Public Affairs responds to a CBS News inquiry, declining to comment on whether Epstein was on suicide watch and referring only to the Attorney General's statement.

keyFacts: On August 11, 2019, CBS News correspondent Matt Pieper was actively seeking confirmation from the Bureau of Prisons on whether Jeffrey Epstein was placed on suicide watch while in custody.
The Bureau of Prisons Office of Public Affairs explicitly declined to comment on the specific question regarding Epstein's suicide watch status.
The BOP's only provided response was a link to Attorney General William Barr's official statement regarding Epstein's death, indicating a coordinated or limited public response.
